revised_title: Operational Research and Systems Analysis in Decision Making: A Review
tldr: This article discusses a two-day meeting of the Royal Society that reviewed the progress of operational research and systems analysis since its introduction into industry and civil government after World War II. The papers presented covered topics such as mathematical techniques, methodology, and practical applications in various organizations. The article highlights the ongoing debate about the nature of the subject and the validity of incorporating value judgments into decision-making processes.
